Selected Answer: D
Multiple end-user device models present the greatest challenge to managing an organization's end-user devices.

When an organization has multiple end-user device models, it can be challenging to manage the devices in a consistent manner. Each model may have different hardware and software configurations, which can make it difficult to ensure that security controls are applied consistently across all devices. Additionally, supporting multiple device models can require additional resources and expertise, which can increase the cost and complexity of managing the devices.
